author: @vatanpatel6011
text: Krish, I like your videos. But you have made a mistake here.  You took overlapping training and testing datasets. This is why the accuracy is at 85%. With random train_test_split, the accuracy falls down to 52%. Please use Cross Validation for the same.

author: @susovandey1875
text: Hi Krish... I tried the same code in my system and i have a few queries. Here is what i did 1. Uploaded data in dataframe. 2. Did preprocessing of the whole data and created a combined column containing all the headlines. 3. Then used countvectorizer on this data.  4. Used random forest classifier just like you showed.   Questions :  1. I am getting error "Cannot allocate xxxx bytes of memory..--------> Please tell me why I am getting that. Though it worked on google collab. (Laptop I am using has I5 9th Gen...8GB RAM and integrated graphics card) 2. Why did you not use test train split? Also in your code some of the training data was present in the test data. Data redundant...When i corrected it the accuracy came down to 55%. 3. In the countvectorizer how are you finding out whether it should be univariate or multivariate [why you selected ngram_range=(2,2) and not (1,2)] I am new in this and might be asking a stupid question also....Please help me out.
